assignment1.algorithms

Class BellmanAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment1.algorithms.BellmanAlgorithm
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IterativePolicyEvaluation, PolicyIteration, ValueIteration

    public abstract class BellmanAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the basic code shared by all Bellman-like algorithms implemented for assignment 1.
    Author:
    josago

    • Method Detail

      • getEvaluation

        public float getEvaluation(State env)
        Returns the value of a state.
        Parameters:
        env - A state.
        Returns:
        The value of the given state.

      • getIterations

        public int getIterations()
        Returns the number of iterations that were needed to make the algorithm converge.
        Returns:
        The number of iterations that were needed to make the algorithm converge.

      • innerLoop

        protected float innerLoop(State s,
              int actionPredator,
              Agent prey,
              float gamma)
        This method implements the inner loop of the Bellman-like equations that are used in the algorithms.
        Parameters:
        s - A state.
        actionPredator - An action for the predator.
        prey - A prey agent (including its policy).
        gamma - Discount factor.
        Returns:
        The inner factor for the Bellman-like equation.

      • maxActions

        protected float maxActions(float factor,
               float valueMax,
               float theta,
               java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> listActions,
               int action)
        This method keeps track of the actions that maximize the state-value function.
        Parameters:
        factor - Output of innerLoop() within the loop this function is called from.
        valueMax - Maximum state value so far for an action.
        theta - Level of precision desired (stop condition of the algorithms).
        listActions - List of best actions so far.
        action - The current action within the loop this function is called from.
        Returns:
        Updated maximum state value for an action.
